snippet: Scotland Yard said on Wednesday that the journalists, who previously worked for The News of the World tabloid, were arrested on suspicion of hacking into cellphone messages.
abstract: Scotland Yard says six more journalists who previously worked for News of the World have been arrested on suspicion of hacking into cellphone messages, adding momentum to police investigation that has already cost Rupert Murdoch's newspaper empire in Britain hundreds of millions of dollars.
lead_paragraph: Scotland Yard said on Wednesday that the journalists, who previously worked for The News of the World tabloid, were arrested on suspicion of hacking into cellphone messages.

headline.seo: 6 More British Journalists Held in Hacking Case
headline.main: Six More Journalists Held in British Hacking Case
headline.print_headline: Six More Journalists Held in British Hacking Case
